doc.content:
Thirteen mixed-breed pit bulls, including six young puppies, are scheduled to be euthanized next week in the wake of the Dec. 12 mauling death of 81-year-old Citra resident Alice Broom.
Marion County Code Enforcement officials said Monday the owner of the dogs, Robert Freeman, 67, has until Jan. 14 to request a hearing in hopes of saving the dogs. If Freeman doesn't respond, the dogs will be killed the following morning.
